    MinMax Algorithm for Kalahari Computer Game

    from 06. January 2017
    Author:
    Theo Wilhelm, Jan. 2017

      • getNumberOfEvaluatedMoves

        public int getNumberOfEvaluatedMoves()
        returns the number of evaluated possible moves (game states).
        Returns:
        Number of evaluated moves (game states).

      • clearNumberOfEvaluatedMoves

        public void clearNumberOfEvaluatedMoves()
        clears the number of evaluated moves (sets it to zero)

      • getRecommendedMove

        public KalahariMoveAndResult getRecommendedMove(KalahariFieldsMove initialSituation,
                                                int computerPlayer,
                                                int playerToDraw,
                                                int depth,
                                                int alpha,
                                                int beta)
        Given a dedicated situation this method returns a recommended move that was computed with a MinMax Algorithm developed for zero-sum games (see e.g. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minimax).
        Parameters:
        initialSituation - Initial situation to calculate optimized computer move for (type KalahariFieldsMove)
        computerPlayer - index of computerPlayer (0 or 1)
        playerToDraw - index of payer that is to draw (0 or 1)
        depth - number of moves taken into account in the evaluation of the best computer move (type int). Example: if depth = 3 human's draws, subsequent computer's draws and again subsequent human's draws are taken into account in the MinMax Algorithm.
        alpha - alpha value of alpha-beta pruning for min max algorithm.
        beta - beta value of alpha-beta pruning for min max algorithm.
        Returns:
        recommendedMove: Recommended Move(s) (all until other is to draw) (type KalahariMoveAndResult) See also https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alpha-Beta-Suche or https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alpha-beta_pruning

      • getComputerScore

        public int getComputerScore(KalahariMoveAndResult situation,
                            int computerPlayer)
        This is the evaluation function used by the MinMax Algorithm! Returns the score of the computer player.
        Parameters:
        situation - Situation (=Game State) to calculate the score for (type KalahariMoveAndResult).
        computerPlayer - index of the computer player (0 if computer is player 1 and 1 if computer is player 2)
        Returns:
        score: Difference between computer's score and human player's score.

      • getAvailableMoves

        public java.util.List<KalahariMoveAndResult> getAvailableMoves(KalahariMoveAndResult startMove,
                                                               java.util.List<KalahariMoveAndResult> availableMoves)
        Given a dedicated situation (field, player to draw) returns a List possible moves. The List contains the moves as well as the resulting fields.
        Parameters:
        startMove - Move Object to calculate further moves of same player from (Type KalahariMoveAndResult)
        availableMoves - List of available Moves (Type List of KalahariMoveAndResult objects)
        Returns:
        List of available Moves including Resulting fields (type KalahariFieldsMove)
